Activity: Arrive at the hospital, check emails, and review any updates on influenza protocols or EHR system changes. Talk with @rn-1 @rn-2 @rn-3 about influenza incidence, and the EHR status.
Participate in a brief team huddle to discuss any challenges or concerns related to influenza assessment or EHR documentation. Share my feedback from yesterday's EHR use.
Begin patient rounds. Prioritize patients with respiratory symptoms or those who are considered high-risk. Focus on accurate symptom assessment and EHR documentation.
Assess Patient 7 (Mr. Brown) for influenza symptoms. Document all findings in the EHR using the standardized tool.
Assess Patient 8 (Ms. Wilson) for influenza symptoms. Document all findings in the EHR using the standardized tool.
If influenza testing is needed, collect samples and ensure proper labeling and delivery to the lab.
Continue patient rounds and accurate EHR documentation.
Lunch break. Listen to some music.
Resume patient rounds and influenza symptom assessment, focusing on high-risk patients.
Assess Patient 9 (Mrs. Rodriguez) for influenza symptoms. Document all findings in the EHR.
Review Patient 7's (Mr. Brown) EHR entry for completeness and accuracy.
Review Patient 8's (Ms. Wilson) EHR entry for completeness and accuracy.
Follow up on lab results and document accurately in the EHR.
Check if @trainer-1 has any updated training materials on EHR updates or influenza assessment. If available, review the materials to refresh my knowledge.
Prepare for shift change and communicate relevant patient information to the incoming nurse.
Final documentation and EHR review before leaving for the day.
